Reviews.Title: “Several glitches, poor service”
Reviews.Author: cqfp123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in March 2012. The GOOD: Excellent location within walking distance of Leidseplein. Bus/Tram stop at ~ 100 m. Clean (albeit very small) room. Comfortable (albeit small) bed. Safe large enough for laptop. Complimentary WiFi in room. The BAD: Room is very dimly lit, difficult to see anything at night. No hair dryer in room (can be borrowed from front desk). Long waits for elevator. Mediocre buffet breakfast, not worth 15 euros (or even discounted rate of 9.50). Bathroom with poorly designed sloping floor, gets flooded at every shower. The UGLY: Payment is required at time of check-in. The receptionist (Nataniela) applied dynamic currency conversion without my consent and charged my card in USD instead of euros, which resulted in a higher charge. When I objected, she claimed that they were required to do it that way and she couldn't charge me in euros (sic). Only after I took strong exception and threatened to dispute the charge, she "found a way" to charge me in euros. Phone in room didn't work. Had to complain x 2 and was told they would activate it. After waiting several hours, had to repack and change rooms. Receptionist frequently away from front desk for 15-20 min at a time, resulting in long waits (key card no longer working after 1st day resulted in 30 min wasted). I asked to speak with the manager but was told none was available. Overall not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Small dark rooms on a good location”
Reviews.Author: Hanna1144
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Robert Ramon during a conference in september. I stayed there with a group that made it obvious that the rooms are very different from each other. What they have in common are that they are very small and very dark. But clean though. My single room felt a bit like a wardrobe, but was away from the bigger street and quite quiet at night, the opposite with the rooms on the other side. The breakfast was ok, not more. But the location of the hotel is perfect, just a few minutes walk from Rijksmuseum and Vondelpark.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Review”
Reviews.Author: PhilENewYork
Reviews.Content: I was looking at hotels in Amsterdam and came across some recent reviews of this property and had to say something. I stayed here once and will never again. While the location is perfect, and the common spaces quite nice, the rooms are tiny, even by Amsterdam standards. My colleague felt as if she were in prison during her stay. Bathrooms equally small, TV is too small and too high on wall. For the price and unless you sleep in the common areas, you can do much, much, better.

Reviews.Title: “A very well located boutique hotel in the museum quarter, with the canal and tram transport really close and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: AndyHeadworth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superbly located. It is on the highly regarded shopping street of PC Hoofstraadt (think I have spelt that right) and really close to some of the key museums in Amsterdam. We had the last available room, and were on the top floor in the eaves. While the view was great the room was a little small. That said, it was plenty big enough for us. Beds are comfortable, bathroom very new and the room was perfectly clean and prepared. The management and staff could not be more helpful, and are seemingly on hand at any time at all! The breakfast is basic and continental style, but presented very well with an ever present waiter there to help if needed. They do some wicked scrambled eggs!! A couple of points to note; if you find stairs a problem then getting to breakfast might be an issue,as the lift doesn't go down to the basement, the stairs down there are very steep! The other point is that the sound proofing in the room we stayed in, could have been better. It is certainly not as bad as other hotels I have stayed in, but it was a little annoying at times! Overall, a nice hotel in a quieter part of the city, that is well positioned and enjoyable to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Achto S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days and I have to say I loved it! Great location, the rooms were small but clean and the staff was very friendly and attentive! Free wifi available! Will definitely stay there on my next Amsterdam trip!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Ushi
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive after reading some reviews although friends had told us this was a great hotel to stay. They were right! Hotel is quite small, rooms are quite small (where in Europe will you find a large room?) but it was a perfect stay. The hotel is located in simply one of the best areas in Amsterdam, walking distance of many Museums and other nice places to go. The bed was very comfortable, shower and bathroom were more than ok and overall I would recommend this hotel. I didn't have breakfast there; my friends recommended a nice place called "B & B" which was located just in front of Hard Rock Cafe which was superb for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Wonderbra_Star
Reviews.Content: Is not a 4 star hotel so wasn't expecting 4 star ameniies that we take for granted in places now. Bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Shower was hot and powerful. Breakfast was like many 3 star breakfast- sliced meat, cheese, bread and scrambled eggs but the bottle of sparkling wine definately a plus. We didn't pay on arrival but based on previous comments perhaps this was a mistake by reception.Reception were very helpful with directions and maps etcWas a little noisy in room butÂ  they offered ear plugs. They also offered a hairdryer on request. I would stay again if I wanted to be in that area of the city

Reviews.Title: “Location and Outside Fascade can't overcome ......A POOR Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patridge
Reviews.Content: A Warning - You Know we all have that sixth sense that we should listen to...i didnt on this one .. The warning Bells should have sounded when we arrived at reception and they couldnt wait to get my credit card out of my hand to pre - pay ...now thats never going to happen again... The bells should have also sounded when after half an hour of waiting in the Lounge ..or should we say first floor wating area the desk attendant seemed to be carryin half a bed up stairs...still the bells didnt ring. We where then shown the room - 508 you couldnt swing a cat in it - small does not do it justice ... a 'double bed ' that really wasnt, small furniture to try to make the room look bigger, and the killer was a 4ft high cupboard masquerading as a wardrobe to hang your clothes in - 4 coathangers only and i'm having to hang a suit in for an exhibition i'm visiting. But lets also not forget about the window that when closed lets the rain sweep across the window ledge ..so bad we put a towel on it to stop it going on the floor ..and reported to cleaner who gave us a smile and said 'yes we have known about it for Months' This Hotel is based on our experience a rip off ..we have stopped in far superior hotels in Amsterdam ( at least 7 times before). And The Bells i Keep refering to are the Tram & Bicycle Bells the street noise even when the window is shut at 3am is loud ....but they do issue you with 'free' earplugs if you ask-what about better quality insulation.!! Please the only way we will change poor hotels such as this is by not going ... Amsterdam is a tremendous city it doesnt need this type of underperforming establishment And on a final note ....I Regret not checking 'Trip Advisor' before we booked it ...

Reviews.Title: “Gulliver's sweaty travels”
Reviews.Author: NMPitre
Reviews.Content: Big price, small room, no air-conditioner with only one window that opens. Bathroom has a shower, but it's not enclosed and soaks everything in the bathroom and leaves a huge puddle afterwards. I guess that alone entitles you to charge exorbitant prices for mediocre room.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: pmlr
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a nice decoration, rooms were small, and kind of expensive. Would book a more central hotel, and less expensive for next time.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel 3* is about right.”
Reviews.Author: Danny787
Reviews.Content: Just got back from amsterdam staying at the robert ramon hotel. From airport we took train to central and had a walk around as check in was at 2. (but hotel did let us drop our bags off 1st.) metro is the best way to get here from central the number 2 or 5 go right passed or a 40min walk through amsterdam ( if you do not get lost !!!! ) hotel room was small and made to look bigger by using small furniture and high ceilings(walls were very thin) this "modern" more (ikea)rish hotel was mostly clean apart from bathroom that had some smashed glass in the corner,but a bin on the 2nd day was put over it ! ( clever ).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - great rooms and superb service.”
Reviews.Author: DougalJP
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the tall ships festival so the whole city was buzzing. The Hotel itself is ideally located near Vondelpark, Muesumplein and Leidseplein - Â all are well worth a visit. The location is right on a lovely street of shops. As a result walking to and from the hotel at night felt fine. No awkward back alleys or dark streets - great for single travellers, women and famines in that respect. After reading previous reviews I was a bit worried about the Robert Ramon, however personal experience proved it was an excellent choice. The rooms are a good size for Amsterdam, immaculate with a small bathroom (but more than adepuate) and a small TV. But I wasn't staying for the bathroom or Tv so no complaints. The twin beds were comfortable and the free wifi was great. Didn't have brekfast as there was a lovely bagel place 5mins walk away. So can't comment on that. Staff at check-in ad check-out as well as during my stay were always kind and curteous. The only issue is noise on the street outside on a Saturday night. The windows don't keep out the sound and in the warm summer you want them open. The hotel did have earplugs which helped but if a silent hotel on a Saturday is a must I wouldn't recommend this place. Midweek and Friday were fine. I guess is he flip side to the great location. Overall this is a well recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neat room, good location, great sleep! - but not a 4* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: diana09Brussels
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the hotel. It was super clean, cosy and the beds are very comfy. It is 3min walking from Leidsplein (shopping, bars, restaurants, Rijskmuseum, Van Gogh, etc) and the hotel itself is in a very posh aread with Chanel, Louis Vuitton and many others high class stores. Overall impression: good to (almost) very good. I've read in other reviews the rooms were a bit small and indeed they are.. specially for a triple room. It is not a 4star hotel (the logo of the hotel can be misleading). It is a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, false advertisement”
Reviews.Author: fede123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and the Robert Ramon is the most overpriced I have ever been in. I went to Amsterdam with 2 friends. We reserved a triple room for 180 euros a night. The first thing that struck me was the sign outside the hotel with the official 3 star rating. The website clearly says it is a 4 star hotel. The lobby was very bland and plain. The elevator was not working. The room was the real kicker though. Their idea of a triple room is a single with 3 small beds. The third bed awkwardly placed without even a lamp on the bedside. The flat screen tv mentioned on the website is in fact a very small and cheap tv (Im including a picture). There were no cupboards or dressers to fit the clothes of 3 people. I complained to the receptionist and wanted to cancel my stay. Conveniently, the Robert Ramon charges for your full stay as soon as you check in. No wonder... they probably have to deal with a lot of clients who want their money back. I was told that I would not be able to get a refund for the first day as there is a 48 hour cancellation policy. I asked for a better rate for the second night and was told that when I booked I knew what the rooms looked like from the website. The rooms look nothing like in the website, never mind the false advertisement claiming it is a 4 star hotel. I go to Amsterdam often, I know the price of hotel rooms there; 180 euros goes a long way. I was ripped off. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Piet Hein, just 2 blocks away from the Robert Ramon.

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RenataPoland
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect. Hotel rooms are very nice (refurbished), bathrooms look oldish but clean. One day we had problems with hot water, in return we received free breakfast. It can be very noisy in some rooms, we had a room facing the street (with tram) but the hotel provided us with ear plugs, so I slept like a baby. The only thing I did't like in the hotel was : scrambled eggs, which was artificial and not eatable. Overally, it is very good hotel for the price. If I go to Amsterdam again I will definitly stay at Robert Ramon.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the chance to try it!”
Reviews.Author: Evvee
Reviews.Content: We saw the Trip Advisor page on Robert Ramon but saw it had no reviews. It looked nice and the price was right so I booked this hotel via our travel agent who took our credit card to hold the room and provided us with a confirmation number and paperwork showing we had a triple room booked for 2 nights. We assumed we were good to go. (YES, I should have booked it with Trip Advisor!) Upon arrival at Robert Ramon (after a 45 minute subway ride in Brussels and a 2 hour train ride to Amsterdam followed by navigating Amsterdam with a 10 year old and three suitcases), we were to say the least, tired and stressed but ready to check in. Alas, the Robert Ramon claimed they didn't have our reservation and no rooms available for two nights. After a futile attempt by our travel agent to correct the situation, they only offered us the ability to find another hotel in Amsterdam. From what we could observe with the staff, they were new, timid and lacked confidence (and apparently the ability to help us), so they asked the manager to come up from the basement. The manager was abrupt but polite and told us there was nothing she could do and mocked our travel agent for making this error - not taking any responsibility what-so-ever. I immediately called our agent on my cell phone and she agreed to talk to them, but still wouldn't budge. She called one hotel, booked it and gave us directions how to get there, so for that we can thank her. Little did we know it was on the edge of the Red Light District - however it was much less expensive than Robert Ramon, the staff there was VERY helpful and the rooms were clean. The hotel was similar to what we saw here on Trip Advisor. I was surprised at the sparce, TINY lobby. We had to be buzzed into the lobby by the front desk staff so I'm assuming they've either had issues with transients or they prefer the security. Neutral mono-chromatic decor, looked very modern. The hotel appeared to still be doing some renovations as well. Save your money if you want to avoid snooty staff and mixups - The Terminus Hotel on Beursstraat was a MUCH better choice!

HotelInfo.Name: Robert Ramon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: P.C. Hofstraat 24-28, Amsterdam 1071 BX, The Netherlands
